labels.analysis: The MCP Server is primarily focused on browser monitoring and automation, providing tools for capturing browser data, running various audits (accessibility, performance, SEO, best practices), and interacting with browser elements. It enables AI-powered applications to gain real-time insights into browser activity and optimize web applications. The tools allow for logging management, screenshots, and element selection, which are useful for debugging and quality assurance.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Browser Automation" is chosen because the server enables automated interaction with browser elements and captures logs, errors, and network activity. "Web Search & Research" is a secondary label because the audits (SEO, accessibility, performance) help in researching and optimizing web pages. "Development Tools" is another secondary label since the debugger and audit modes are useful for developers.

server_info_crawled.name: BrowserTools
server_info_crawled.author: @diulela/browser-tools-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable AI-powered applications to monitor and interact with your browser seamlessly. Capture browser data, run audits for accessibility, performance, SEO, and best practices, and analyze web pages directly from your IDE. Enhance your AI tools' awareness and capabilities with real-time browser insights and automated audits.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@diulela/browser-tools-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
